title: I have lots of trouble with Wall Jumping as Riven
body: Every time I try to jump with her 3rd Q and I e directly towards the wall I want to jump at it spazzes out and moves me to the right, thus failing me to jump. Is this because I am misplaced or it usually happens?

replies.body:
ok, so you open up a bot game and just practice for 30 minutes while looking at this http://i.imgur.com/7XL3n.jpg

it's a little tricky, you basically want to approach the wall at 90 degrees in most cases and be a little bit away from the wall when you use your 3rd q.
But it's definitely something you want to master as riven, you could potentially try to {{champion:92}}  jungle as well in normals if you want more practice as it's often used to gank. (although your teamates might get pissy if you don't snowball)

good luck!

Yeah, I have problems with it too. Two things to remember:
1. DON'T click where you want to end up, click where you want to be WHEN you jump. This is due to auto-pathing and also to the fact that Riven jumps in the way she is facing, not towards to cursor. I think this should be changed, but obviously Riot doesn't so yeah, we have to deal with it.
2. She can only jump relatively skinny walls. Don't over-estimate her leap distance, and find a map to look at to make it easier. Also, contrary to unpopular belief, her Ult does not increase the range/distance of her leap, just the area she does damage in.

"I knew I should have sprung for the broken blade warranty..." - {{champion:92}}
Try E ---> Right-Click (at your feet) ---> Q so that auto-pathing doesn't make you face away from the wall.

You can't jump all walls as Riven. The walls you can jump: try having your path only go to the point you're going to jump **from**. So don't right click where you're going to being Q'ing to. Path to where you're going to jump from, and then Q. 

I find if I'm pathing to where I want to jump **to** the Q will go along the wall instead of over.

Because your Autopathing yourself to turn so you go around the wall

Also with regards to OP, using the E can somewhat affect where your last move click is (which determines the direction of your jump) so it might be better to leave the E and just use the Q for the wall jump
